intro: Astragalus golmunensis, commonly known as the Golmün Astragalus, is a flowering plant species native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its root system is deep and fibrous, allowing it to access water from deeper soil layers. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
